author: Karnataka Bureau
text:
A 33-year-old taxi driver was sentenced and convicted to 10 years rigorous imprisonment and a fine of Rs. 30,000 by the Additional Sessions Court for raping an eight-year old girl who was his neighbour in Mico Layout four years ago. The accused, Manjunath, a resident of Bilekahalli, had raped the victim when she went to his house to watch a TV show.

Two held on theft charge

The Subramanya Nagar police have arrested two people — a 26-year-old habitual offender and a PU student — who attempted to rob a pharmacist on West of Chord Road on February 24.

The two remaining accused had died in a road accident immediately after the attack, while trying to leave the spot. While Shashi Kumar was remanded to judicial custody, the juvenile was sent to the State home for boys and referred the case to Child Welfare Committee.
title: 10-yr RI for cab driver in rape case
